pros: Passionate members and cool environment
cons: Low salary and a lot of work

pros: - good way to try out functions without having a job -nice people
cons: - pressure from management although this is a student organization

Learn about cultural differences 
Challenging experience 
Work with branches from more than 110 countries

pros:
- amazing vibe from the team
- great place to develop leadership skills

job_title: Vice President Talent Development in Bucharest, Bucuresti
pros: Great great amazing superb amazing!
cons: None so far - AIESEC was amazing

review_title: Extremely nice atmoshepre and great people
pros:
International environment
Freedom of speech
Lots of events
cons: Takes a lot of time and involvement

pros:
AIESEC offers the best practical experience for students. You not only get to develop the skills you will need in a future workplace, but the community, the conferences and the whole culture behind it will make your Uni years 10000 times better. 

The great part about it is that you can be a part of various teams during your time in AIESEC, such as sales, marketing, project coordination, etc, so you get an insight into what you can do in the future. 

Last, but not least, you have the opportunity to travel and meet international students as the core of the NGO is international exchange.
cons: Not necessarily a con, but this is a volunteer position. You will also need to pay for your own expenses for conferences and such.

pros:
-A place where to meet new people
-A place where to get internship opportunities
-A place where to get experience in local or international projects
cons:
-Too many meetings
-Too much brain washing
-An attitude of superiority of those who are old in the organization towoards those who just want to make a change in their activities, and not to get totally brain washed

job_title: Team Manager, External Relations Department in Cluj-Napoca
pros: Great people and organization structure. Offers many chances to travel and expand horizons
cons: Depends mainly of the city but as I noticed some larger cities tend to be offered more chances by the headquarters. That's not great for students involved in Aiesec's smaller cities

pros: you feel find a young team , very dedicated people which will help you when ever you need, and you will be able to improve your skills.
cons: i think that some of the downsides would be the fact that when are brought new people to organization it would be nicer to offer them more team buildings.

review_title: Great NGO for young people to grow in an international context
job_title: Member of National Committee In One of the AIESEC Countries in Cluj-Napoca
pros:
Great organization for young people to develop their soft skills and discover their professional interests.
Provides exposure to internationalism and the possibility of being part of great, life-changing international experiences.
One of the most democratic organizations in the world.
cons: Nothing at the moment. Suitable for those willing to evaluate themselves in an objective manner.

review_title: Great place to learn by doing
job_title: Design and Communication Dep in Cluj-Napoca
pros: Young team, opportunities to learn, international exposure.
cons:
- too many people are pulling towards too many directions sometimes in a hectic way ;
- not much constancy of purpose ;

pros:
internationalism is the main word for the AIESEC experience
you get to socialize and meet people from all over the world
learn new things
cons: you don`t get to do too many concrete things, though... it`s mostly about developing your personal and interpersonal skills

job_title: E P Trainee in Bucharest, Bucuresti
pros: very diversified, with a lot of opportunities, amazing events held by interns and chances to meet other people
cons: not a paid internship however shelter and food is provided so it's fine, noting to complain

review_title: It was an important part of my life and it has helped me get where I am and I'm appreciative of that,
pros:
- personal development;
- leadership conferences;
cons: No cons to share at this time;

review_title: Very nice place to volunteer at
pros: Very well constructed teams and environment. Enjoyed it very much cause i got exposed to a lot of situation that i had to find solutions to.
cons: None really any cons i can think of.

pros: For all the students in Bucharest, AIESEC is a good oportunity to gain useful skills for real life, have acces to an international network, including in corporate sector.
cons: All the good things come after volunteer work

job_title: National Vice President Social Projects in Bucharest, Bucuresti
pros:
Work environment 
Organizational culture
Benefits are alright
cons: The workload is huge and very stressful, limited HR

cons: A lot of work, but it's fun
